title: Does technology pose a threat to our private life? - Quora

response.answer_text: Definitely – but not for the reasons that most people think The reasons is because most people don't realise how much information they are sending out about themselves. Think about how much people put on their social media, think of how much people put out about themselves on this (Opinions, considerations, communications). People have given their privacy because they wanted to. The technology isn't the issue. It is the people who use it. By the huge amount of technology that we have, and the way it is sending out this information, we are tracked far more than ever.

It can, when implemented incorrectly. Unfortunately, developers seem rather intent on implementing it incorrectly, and most users are worryingly unconcerned by this. In fact, many people seem to think that having their personal privacy utterly annihilated is the coolest thing ever.
